file_content.text: Chance. I came to meet you.
Thank you. I'm not--please listen.
Ianna Cel is in here somewhere... the scientist Ki Sazen needs to repair the Ultrawave Transmitter.
The scientist will only meet with SIS. Tell her the password. Gemstone.
She won't know anything went wrong. I'm one of you, after all.
I'll take care of it.
Good. Good.
You don't look good. Can you get to a medic?
What about you?
You don't look well. How much blood do you think you've lost? A liter? Two?
Still alive, huh?
If you can patch me up, I can--ah!
If you patch me up, I can get to an evac point. Keyword on--onomat--ah!
After you forced me to come here, I should let you die. But I won't.
Be glad I'm feeling merciful.
Hold still. I'll do what I can.
Don't worry. I'll help.
Can you move?
I think so. I can make it as far as a Republic airlift.
Thank you. Now find the scientist. Keep her safe from Ki Sazen.
You can't say it, can you? Goodbye, Chance.
No more commands. [Leave him]
Please... please....
Sir? Was he a... contact of yours?
Chance is an associate of mine. That's all I can tell you.
In short, yes.
I'm afraid I can't tell you that.
He's with the SIS.
Don't ask.
I understand, sir. I don't mean to step out of line.
Clever. But you can't kill them all this way.
You let him live. Now he still has control--but he trusts you. Useful.
I keep hearing your voice. How is that possible?
Who are you?
I don't know what you are, or where you're coming from. Just go away.
Get out of my head.
[Ignore the voice]
This is Chance to Legate. Can you hear me?
Legate to Chance. I stopped Ki Sazen's servants--they won't be getting that rakghoul colony data.
Fantastic. I wish my news were that good.
You don't sound good.
Yeah. Blaster burns, but the shrapnel's worse.
You were after that scientist--the one Ki Sazen wanted.
Running into problems?
I found her. She agreed to meet me in the ruins.
You'll have to talk louder. I can barely read you.
Speak up.
I'll do what I can, but I'm not feeling so good.
I tracked down that scientist Ki Sazen is after. She agreed to meet me in the ruins.
I was on my way when Imperial scouts spotted me. I ditched them, but I'm bleeding fast.
Don't move. Tell me where you are, and I'll be there soon.
I'll come help you.
I'm--look, I have to be sure.
You said the scientist was meeting you in the ruins. Where?
Where's the scientist?
Somewhere close by. I'll explain, but--I have to be sure.
Try to ignore the pain. You'll pass out soon enough.
Enjoy your ugly death.
How can you--? Never mind. It doesn't matter.
Keyword: onomatophobia. I'm ordering you to my location at Dynamet General. Sending coordinates now.
Are you reprogramming me?
I would've come anyway!
You'll regret doing this.
I am on my way to Dynamet General.
I'm sorry, Cipher. It's just... I don't want to die like this.
They can't resist using it. But you still have your mind. You can still think. That's your escape.
This is Legate to Chance. We have a situation with Ki Sazen.
Chance here, sir. I'm listening...
Building a rakghoul army with the Ultrawave Transmitter. Why...?
She has two more sets of followers, then. One going after this Republic scientist, one after the rakghoul colony data. We'll have to split up to stop them both.
We need to divide our resources.
Agreed.
Time for you to do some field work.
Ready for some action?
Looks like it, sir.
Now I get to see how much you can handle.
[Flirt] Should be interesting.
Are you--never mind. Later.
My mission was to find proof of Ki Sazen's corruption. I found proof. I'm done.
My part in this is finished.
You've seen proof, but nothing admissible. And Master Kothe's contacts on the Jedi Council are... cautious.
I'll try to find our scientist before the Nikto do. If this "Doctor Cel" works for the colonists, I should have a shot.
You need to figure out where they'd go for rakghoul colony scans.
I'll talk to Doctor Lokin. He knows the science, and he knows Taris; he could be our lead.
I know who might help.
I was afraid you'd say that. All right--but don't trust him. Chance out.
I met a man named Doctor Lokin. He knows the science, and he knows Taris; he could be our lead.
I know who might help.
I saw his call to you. Our file on him is almost empty, except for his kill sheet.
I think you're right that he can help--just don't trust him. Chance out.
Any suggestions?
You handle the rakghoul research, and I'll rescue the brilliant scientist.
Why don't we switch jobs?
Not in Republic territory, you won't.
Your best chance may be Doctor Lokin. He knows the science, the transmitter and the rakghouls. And he's smarter than me.
I've been listening to your calls, and I know you're in touch with a "Doctor Lokin."
His file makes him into a ghost--twelve confirmed kills over thirty years, and nothing else--but he knows the science, the transmitter and the rakghouls.
I'm not saying trust him--but he could help us stop the Nikto. Chance out.
This is Chance to Legate. Come in, Legate.
I know you're busy, sir, so I'll keep it short. Any progress finding Ki Sazen?
I met a "Doctor Lokin" at Nasan Godera's lab. He thinks Sazen is raiding facilities across Taris--I'm en route to one now.
I'm following this lead....
That's great. That name rings a bell, though... hold on.
Doctor Eckard Lokin, Imperial Intelligence. Twelve confirmed kills over thirty years. Not a lot in the file....
Be careful with that man, okay? And contact me when you find anything.
I was hoping you'd turn up something.
Maybe you can tell me.
The SIS doesn't have much presence on Taris, and the military hasn't seen much of Sazen since she landed.
We're in the dark, but I'll keep looking. Contact me if you find anything.
I'm drowning in toxic chemicals, and you want a status report?
Talk to me later, kid.
Yes, sir. I may be running this operation, but I'm also here to help you.
So please contact me when things calm down or if anything changes. All right?
I'll be in touch, Chance.
Understood.
Just so you know, sir? I don't agree with how Master Kothe is handling you. I have the codes, but I don't plan to use them.
Chance out.
Hmm, authority looks good on you.
[Flirt] Aren't you adorable?
That... wasn't really what I was going for. But thank you.
If this is how you treat a defector, I'd love to see you manage Republic personnel.
Are all SIS agents so polite?
You have a great deal of field experience. I respect that.
And for the record? I don't agree with how Master Kothe is using the command codes. I'd like to make up for it.
Can't talk now. Some sort of electrical discharge.
I'm losing you. [Disconnect]
I'm sorry, is there something you need?
